channel.title: Test scape
channel.description:
testscape is annoying,
HOW DO U MAKE ADMINS ON IT??
and no, modifying the players rights in the characters folder DOSE NOT work (like pimpscape)

item.title: Test scape
item.dc:creator: @Muffinator Muffinator
item.description:
@Muffinator wrote:

Open up client.java and search for:

/start of moderator/admin list, 1 = mod, 2 = staff, 3 = admin

After you find that, you will see something like this:

[code]if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 3;
}

else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 2;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 1;
}
else if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))
{
playerRights = 1;
}[/code]

In the if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""))Put your username in the ("")

For example if your name is Admin, It should look like this:

if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Admin"))

Oh and the “playerRights = 3;” is important to understand.

3 = Co-Owner/Owner, 2 = Administrator, 1 = Moderator

Read full topic
